Stem: Woody, brittle. Hairless even when young.
Leaves: Very small 3.5-7 mm long, cylindrical, almost pine-like. In whorls of 3 or 4.
Flowers: Tiny white or green and bell-shaped 1-2 mm long. Densely clustered along branches.
Habitat: Disturbed areas, roadsides, forests, grasslands, riparian areas.
DistinguishingFeatures: Smaller flowers than other invasive heaths (*Erica* species).
